Description: Black terracotta figure of Zeus and his eagle. Zeus seated on his eagle, left leg crossed over right. A himation is draped over his head, covering his legs and falling down over the left shoulder. His sceptre rests diagonally against his left shoulder. The lower part, including the eagle’s feet and the plinth, is lost: the break has been filed down in modern times to make the object stand. The back is plain except for a raised rim round a circular vent. Hollow; two-piece mould. Micaceous grey Nile silt (fired in a reducing atmosphere) with a black surface, probably a slip.
Curator's comments: BM Terracotta IV Comparanda. Close and near: Breccia 1934: no. 144; Fischer 1994: no. 796, dated second century ad: perhaps based on coin types of Trajan = Fischer 1995: pl. xlv:7 = Vogt 1924: pl. xxvi:2; Kaufmann 1913: fig. 16:3; Schmidt 1997: no. 101, dated second century ad; Sotheby’s Sale Catalogue, 8–9 December 1986: lot 119; Van Wijngaarden 1958: no. 39; Weber 1914: no. 281, said to be from the Fayum. Bibliog. Fischer 1994: no. 796.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3325)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Rev Greville John Chester
